channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: European countries are set for Iran talks, but expectations for a breakthrough are low
item.description: Germany, France and the United Kingdom will hold talks with Iran in Istanbul Friday, just days after the three European nations warned they would reimpose stiff sanctions on Tehran.
item.content:encoded:
Germany, France and the United Kingdom will hold talks with Iran in Istanbul Friday, just days after the three European nations warned they would reimpose stiff sanctions on Tehran.

(Image credit: Ronald Zak)
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: Trump administration approves sale of CBS parent company Paramount
item.description: The Federal Communications Commission approved the sale of Paramount Global after the buyer made pledges to showcase a diversity of viewpoints and root out alleged bias in CBS' news coverage.
item.content:encoded:
The Federal Communications Commission approved the sale of Paramount Global after the buyer made pledges to showcase a diversity of viewpoints and root out alleged bias in CBS' news coverage.

(Image credit: Dimitrios Kambouris/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Supreme Court blocks rule that blocks Voting Rights Act for now
item.description: The order guarantees voters, at least for now, the ability to sue to enforce rights guaranteed under the landmark 1965 law.
item.content:encoded:
The order guarantees voters, at least for now, the ability to sue to enforce rights guaranteed under the landmark 1965 law.

(Image credit: Drew Angerer)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Six months in, how Trump has changed the Education Department.
item.description:
Federal education policy has seen a lot of changes since President Trump's inauguration. For example, the Department of Education itself, which Trump has vowed to close.

But that hasn't stopped the Trump administration from also wielding the Department's power. Most recently, by withholding billions of dollars for K-12 schools.

The Trump administration has drastically changed the federal government's role in education. What does that mean for American classrooms?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
item.content:encoded:
Federal education policy has seen a lot of changes since President Trump's inauguration. For example, the Department of Education itself, which Trump has vowed to close.

But that hasn't stopped the Trump administration from also wielding the Department's power. Most recently, by withholding billions of dollars for K-12 schools.

The Trump administration has drastically changed the federal government's role in education. What does that mean for American classrooms?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

(Image credit: J. David Ake)

item.title: Trump visits Federal Reserve and tussles with Jerome Powell in extraordinary moment
item.description: President Trump visited the Federal Reserve to inspect an ongoing renovation and disagreed with the Fed chair about the project's final cost in an extraordinary moment.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump visited the Federal Reserve to inspect an ongoing renovation and disagreed with the Fed chair about the project's final cost in an extraordinary moment.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Rafael Nam

item.title: Trump signs an executive order to make it easier to remove homeless people from streets
item.description: The White House directive calls for prioritizing money for programs that require sobriety and treatment, and for cities that enforce homeless camping bans.
item.content:encoded:
The White House directive calls for prioritizing money for programs that require sobriety and treatment, and for cities that enforce homeless camping bans.

(Image credit: Mark Makela)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: Questions about Epstein files follow lawmakers home
item.description: It's just the start of a summer recess for Congress, but already House Republicans are being asked questions back home about the push to release records related to the late Jeffrey Epstein.
item.content:encoded:
It's just the start of a summer recess for Congress, but already House Republicans are being asked questions back home about the push to release records related to the late Jeffrey Epstein.

(Image credit: Tom Williams)
item.dc:creator: Carmen Russell-Sluchansky

item.title: Supreme Court keeps a pause for now on a ruling that weakens the Voting Rights Act
item.description: The Supreme Court has extended a pause, for now, on a lower court ruling that struck down a key tool for protecting minority voters under the Voting Rights Act in seven states.
item.content:encoded:
The Supreme Court has extended a pause, for now, on a lower court ruling that struck down a key tool for protecting minority voters under the Voting Rights Act in seven states.

(Image credit: Jemal Countess)
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang

item.title: Trump's cuts to National Parks are real but many visitors aren't seeing them yet
item.description: DOGE cuts to the National Park Service spawned fears of widespread problems for park visitors during peak summer season, as parks continue to see record visit numbers. The cuts are real, but mostly invisible.
item.content:encoded:
DOGE cuts to the National Park Service spawned fears of widespread problems for park visitors during peak summer season, as parks continue to see record visit numbers. The cuts are real, but mostly invisible.

(Image credit: Kirk Siegler)
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler

item.title: Trump administration scrutiny of academic institutions stretches beyond elite colleges
item.description: After pressuring elite universities, the Trump administration is now focusing on George Mason. Education reporter Katherine Mangan discusses why GMU's president says it's a backlash to DEI efforts.
item.content:encoded: After pressuring elite universities, the Trump administration is now focusing on George Mason. Education reporter Katherine Mangan discusses why GMU's president says it's a backlash to DEI efforts.
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley
